Flub.Name: Strength
Flub.Description: The strength of the indentations created by the node.

Flub.Name: Scale
Flub.Description: The size of the geological features.

Flub.Name: Octaves
Flub.Description: The number of octaves or iterations of breakage.

Flub.Name: Sweep
Flub.Description: The number of iterations of for lateral erosion from flowing water. When the Scale value is high, a larger number of Sweep iterations may be required to smooth the rock strata.

Flub.Name: Depth
Flub.Description: The average depth of the indentations.

Flub.Name: Density
Flub.Description: The density of the indentation structure. Negative values create deep and wide crevices, while positive values fuse the crevices together, leaving small pockets.

Flub.Name: Fragmentation
Flub.Description: The amount of breakage of the rock strata in each iteration. High values require fewer octaves, but create more uniformity.

Flub.Name: Seed
Flub.Description: The randomization pattern or seed for the node's process.

Flub.Name: Warped
Flub.Description: Add warping to each octaves to create slightly curved shapes.

Flub.Name: Reverse
Flub.Description: Reverse the structure of the indentations. This creates sharper crevices and edges.

Flub.Name: Hard Effect
Flub.Description: By default, the indentations are softened based on altitude and slope. For low surfaces or if a deeper effect is required, turn this option on.
